info.name: Codeforces Contest API
info.description:
Complete collection of Codeforces Contest API endpoints

**Organization:**
- GraphQL APIs: Fetch directly from Codeforces API
- WRITE APIs: Fetch from Codeforces API and store in MongoDB
- READ APIs: Read data from MongoDB only

**When adding new requests:**
1. Add GraphQL requests in the "GraphQL APIs" folder
2. Add WRITE requests in the "WRITE APIs" folder
3. Add READ requests in the "READ APIs" folder
4. Update src/routes/codeforcesRoutes.js if needed
5. Update ARCHITECTURE.md if needed

item.name: GraphQL APIs
item.description:
GraphQL endpoints that fetch directly from Codeforces API (not from DB)

**Base URL:** {{graphql_base_url}}

**When adding new GraphQL requests:**
1. Add your request in this folder
2. Use POST method to {{graphql_base_url}}
3. Set Content-Type: application/json
4. Add query in body as JSON

request.description: Get list of all Codeforces contests (excluding gym contests)
Get list of all Codeforces contests (including gym contests)
Get contest standings for official participants only
Get contest standings including unofficial participants
Get all submissions for a contest

item.name: Get Submissions for User in Contest

request.description: Get submissions for a specific user in a contest
Get rating changes for a contest
Get hacks for a contest
Get complete contest data (all data types) for official participants only
Get complete contest data (all data types) including unofficial participants

item.name: WRITE APIs
item.description:
REST APIs that fetch data from Codeforces API and store it in MongoDB.

**Base URL:** {{rest_base_url}}

**Storage:**
- Standings → BatchedStandingsData collection (separate)
- Submissions, RatingChanges, Hacks → BatchedContestData collection
- Uses batched storage (1000 records per document) for optimal performance

**When adding new WRITE APIs:**
1. Add your request in this folder
2. Add corresponding route handler in src/routes/codeforcesRoutes.js (WRITE APIs section)
3. Add service method in src/services/codeforcesDataService.js if needed
4. Update ARCHITECTURE.md if needed

request.description:
Fetches complete contest data from Codeforces API and stores in MongoDB.

**Storage:**
- Standings → BatchedStandingsData collection
- Submissions, RatingChanges, Hacks → BatchedContestData collection

**Performance:**
- Uses bulk write operations (6-10x faster)
- Automatically detects new vs existing data
- Returns performance metrics
Fetches complete contest data including unofficial participants and stores in MongoDB
Alternative way to pass showUnofficial parameter via POST body
Fetches all contests from Codeforces API (excluding gym) and stores in MongoDB
Fetches all contests from Codeforces API (including gym) and stores in MongoDB
Alternative way to pass includeGym parameter via POST body

item.name: READ APIs
item.description:
REST APIs that only read data from MongoDB. They do NOT fetch from Codeforces API.

**Base URL:** {{rest_base_url}}

**Collections:**
- Standings → BatchedStandingsData collection
- Submissions → BatchedContestData collection

**When adding new READ APIs:**
1. Add your request in this folder
2. Add corresponding route handler in src/routes/codeforcesRoutes.js (READ APIs section)
3. Use models directly or dataService query methods
4. Add pagination if returning large datasets
5. Update ARCHITECTURE.md if needed

request.description: Get contest metadata, problems, and counts of related data from database
Get first 100 standings from database (reads from BatchedStandingsData collection)
Get standings with pagination (limit and skip parameters)
Get unofficial standings only
Get first 100 submissions from database (reads from BatchedContestData collection)
Get submissions with pagination (limit and skip parameters)
Get submissions for a specific user handle
